Sex site Kink’s new CEO moves ahead, unchained from past San Francisco Chronicle Logo Hearst Newspapers Logo Skip to main content Subscribe Bay Area San Francisco Transit Crime Drug Crisis Golden Gate Park COVID-19 Health Data Spotlight PG&E Season of Sharing Housing Crisis Total SF Graying Bay Weather Weather Forecast Air Quality Tracker Climate Drought Fire Tracker Quake Tracker Wildfires Food Top Restaurants Restaurants Restaurant Closures Top Wineries Wine, Beer & Spirits Sports Giants Warriors 49ers A's High School Bay FC Women's Sports College Politics Election 2024 Opinions Chronicle Editorial Board Letters to the Editor Home Insurance Home Insurance Rates Real Estate Find a Home Commercial Real Estate California Tahoe Tech Datebook U.S. & World Travel Outdoors Vault: Our S.F. In-Depth Comics About Us Newsroom News Terms of Use Code of Conduct Privacy Notice Your Privacy Choices (Opt Out of Sale/Targeted Ads) Advertise With Us Reader Tools Audio Tours Obituaries Place an obituary Newsletters Download our App Store Back Issues San Francisco Chronicle Logo Subscribe Trending: Charlie Kirk’s killing | Deadly Oakland shootout | La Niña odds | New restaurants | Bay Area incomes | S.F. sober shelter | Rare snake Biz & Tech Sex site Kink’s new CEO moves ahead, unchained from past By Benny Evangelista Updated May 10, 2018 4:22 p.m. Alison Boden, CEO of Cybernet Entertainment, which runs the online fetish and BDSM site Kink.com, photographed in the Kink.com headquarters in San Francisco, California, on May 9th, 2018. Photos by Peter Prato / Special to The Chronicle Alison Boden, CEO of Cybernet Entertainment, which runs the online fetish and BDSM site Kink.com, photographed in the Kink.com headquarters in San Francisco, California, on May 9th, 2018. Peter Prato / Special to The Chronicle A detail of merchandise in the basement of the new headquarters of Kink.com in San Francisco, California, on May 9th, 2018. Peter Prato / Special to The Chronicle Alison Boden, CEO of Cybernet Entertainment, which runs the online fetish and BDSM site Kink.com, photographed in the Kink.com headquarters in San Francisco, California, on May 9th, 2018. Peter Prato / Special to The Chronicle Kink.com has seen plenty of belt-tightening over the years, with people tied to objects like chairs in the name of bondage. But recently the straps have become snugger financially, too, as free pornography has dug into its business. Now, the bondage video company — part of San Francisco’s tech and sex scene — is undergoing a transformation, with a new CEO, a different headquarters and a shift from porn video production to content distribution and e-commerce. “We have had a couple of hard years, and we had to make some difficult choices,” CEO Alison Boden told The Chronicle. “Now we are focused on having the platform for folks to find the best fetish and (bondage- and sadomasochism-related) content.” Advertisement Article continues below this ad Boden, 35, took over the top spot in March from Peter Acworth, the bondage enthusiast who founded the company, officially known as Cybernet Entertainment, 21 years ago. The change follows the sale by Acworth of Kink’s former headquarters, the historic Armory in the Mission District , for $65 million. That deal, which closed in January, netted Acworth more than four times what he paid in 2006 for the 200,000-square-foot castle-style structure. Acworth has stepped away from day-to-day operations to focus on his real estate development and management business. “If there is anyone who can reinvent Kink.com for the new internet, which is awash with free content, it is her,” Acworth said in a statement. “I’ve relied on her judgment and intuition for years.” The changes have ended an “only in San Francisco” era, said Carol Queen, founder and director for the city’s Center for Sex and Culture. A detail of merchandise in the basement of the new headquarters of Kink.com in San Francisco, California, on May 9th, 2018. Peter Prato / Special to The Chronicle In a city with a long history that included the bondage support group Society of Janus and the annual Folsom Street Fair , the Armory under Acworth’s reign “was clearly the kinky Playboy mansion of the 21st century,” Queen said. Advertisement Article continues below this ad Boden, who was vice president of technology, is optimistic that she can turn around a company whose “mission statement isn’t about corporate profits, but ending stigma.” She takes over at a time when growth of subscription revenue for online pornography has slowed due to the proliferation of free porn. The $568.3 million adult porn website industry grew about 10.4 percent annually during the past five years, but that rate is expected to slow to about 3.7 percent annually for the next five years, according to a March report from IBISWorld. Subscription fees account for about three-fourths of that revenue, but the “vast majority of porn consumers do not pay for content,” the report said. “We’re trying to look and see what directions we can grow beyond subscriptions,” Boden said. “That’s everything from selling toys on our store to creating our own toy line to doing workshops to help educate the community.” Kink.com has traditionally focused on a subset of porn fans: those who are into BDSM, a category that includes erotic bondage, discipline, submission and other forms of sexual role playing. Acworth, who was unavailable to comment for this story beyond a statement, has said that the company’s revenue plunged by 50 percent from 2013 to 2016 as membership dropped. Advertisement Article continues below this ad The “free porn onslaught” sent the privately held company into the red, Boden said. “It’s hard to get people to pay for porn. You can’t really beat free for a certain percentage of people.” The company went from producing 80 movies each month in its Armory studios in 2016 to phasing out all production in 2017, Boden said. Kink’s workforce, which was more than 150 in its heyday, was trimmed to about 50 as the company “tightened our belts,” she said. Furniture and props, including a human-size hamster wheel and vintage gynecological chairs, were auctioned in March, and the company moved into a South of Market building. And instead of producing videos, Kink.com has begun licensing and distributing those from independent producers, “many of them folks we used to work with who went out on their own,” Boden said. Advertisement Article continues below this ad One is Ex Libris, who had worked for Kink.com since 2006. Now a San Francisco director who teams with independent female producers, Ex Libris spoke on condition that only her stage name be printed because of the stigma of working in porn. Kink.com in the spotlight At Kink.com’s freaky garage sale, the weird is up for grabs at... For just $385, you could have walked out of San Francisco’s historic Armory with a torture rack Saturday. The 6-foot human hamster wheel was already taken. The old school device, officially known as... SF Armory sells for $65 million — to be used for manufacturing... The new owner of the historic Armory in the Mission District plans to lease the building to manufacturing companies, with the exception of the top two floors, which the investment group hopes to... Porn site Kink.com is holding another prop sale at the Armory this weekend The robotic, piston-based sex machine that can be outfitted with a dildo and other accoutrements sold, but the mattress outfitted with chains is still available. Ex Libris lamented the retreat of a company that promoted safe conditions for sex workers and proudly flew BDSM flags from the top of its headquarters. And though she said she took a financial hit after losing her job at Kink.com after the restructuring, Ex Libris said she believes in Boden’s ability to turn the company around. “I’m really glad that they’re working to make the website financially viable,” she said. The IBISWorld report said the industry’s future could depend on its ability to tap innovations like virtual reality and “smart” adult toys. Advertisement Article continues below this ad Boden said the company has teamed with Doc Johnson Enterprises of North Hollywood to sell Kink-branded sex merchandise, such as personal care products, leather handcuffs, ankle restraints, leashes and inflatable wrestling mats. The company also sells tickets to educational workshops. “Last year, we turned a profit,” Boden said. “The goal is to keep improving on that. I’m really optimistic about where we are going.” Benny Evangelista is a San Francisco Chronicle staff writer. Email: bevangelista@sfchronicle.com Twitter: @ChronicleBenny May 9, 2018 | Updated May 10, 2018 4:22 p.m. Benny Evangelista Most Popular 1 . Charlie Kirk’s killing created a powder keg. SpellTower Word search but with strategy. Clearing the board feels really good. Weather Odds of La Niña developing have increased. Here’s what it means for California weather Bay Area How Bay Area incomes changed in past year — and how they compare with other areas Joe Garofoli Charlie Kirk’s killing created a powder keg. FAQ’s – Kinks Couture Skip to content Skip to footer Home Services About Us Locations AquaFro Growth Organics Shop Home Services About Us Locations AquaFro Growth Organics Shop FAQ’s Close Home Services About Us Locations AquaFro Growth Organics Shop Have a Project? info@website.com Want to Enroll Now? Find Courses Want to Buy Supplies? Go to Shop I am a new client; how do I book my appointment? Welcome to Kinks Couture and thank you for choosing our services.  We take bookings on different platforms – by text messages: 954-297-6105, Call 954-534-9006 (Pembroke Pines Location) or 305-985-8886, Call 305-964-7096 (Cutler Bay location). We also take appointments through FB and IG social media platforms as well as via Google.  For every first-time guest doing a natural hairstyle or locs, there is a $30 deposit required to book Why do I need to make a deposit and how do I make it? There are different reasons for a Deposit Voucher: a) First time clients with natural hairstyles/locs/treatments – deposits start at $35; b) any braids/twists with extensions require a deposit, you may also check our pricing list for the styles with extensions that require deposit. c) booking outside of normal business hours require a deposit; d) clients who have no-shows, cancellations in less than 48 hrs. or excessive tardiness require a deposit. To make your deposit, you can go to our website and purchase the appropriate voucher or make the payment over the phone. What are the stipulations for making deposits? All deposits are non-refundable when any changes are made to appointments in less than 48 hrs. Changes include cancellation, changing extension style to natural hairstyle or for a lesser priced style, or moving appointment to another day. What is your protocol or refunding payments for hair services? Kinks Couture has a NO REFUND policy for all hair services. Because we value our output and the satisfaction of our clients, we however try our best to back up any dissatisfied styles by fixing the issue.  If client is having issues with the styles they receive, clients must inform us within 24 hours of service, and we will in turn give availability to return based on stylist availability or with another stylist. If I have a complaint, how do I go about lodging it? We appreciate all reports, good and bad, when it comes to your experience with us.  We ask that you send an email to kinkscouture@gmail.com , or call the main line: Pembroke Pines: 954-534-9006 [text 954-297-6105].  Or Cutler Bay: 305-964-7096 [text 305-985-8886].  Once your report is received, a manager will call you back, within 24 hrs., to resolve any issues I would like to book an appointment to get braids with extensions, do I have to send a picture? Yes.  For us to be on the same page with the exact service you need, a picture message should be sent to 954-297-6105 (Pembroke Pines) or 305-985-8886 (Cutler Bay).   This helps us to better book your appointment with the most suitable stylist and with the allotted time needed, as well as giving you a starting price The receptionist only gave me a starting price over the phone, when do I get the exact price of the hair style I requested? Prices for every hair service varies. If you are getting a natural hair style, price varies based on the length and thickness of your hair, the size and design of braids or twists to be done, and the crown size of your head.  If you are getting extensions, final prices are also based on length and thickness of hair, crown size of head, as well as size and length of extensions to be installed.  If you have locs, final price is based on length and size of your locs, length of new growth and work to be done. Our Front Desk Coordinators are only able to give you starting prices when you call or text to make an appointment. Once the hair stylists see your hair in person, and pictures of the size and length you need, that’s when you will be accurately given a final price I want to start my locs journey, how do I make an appointment? Start-up locs require a consultation before booking an appointment.  We offer free consultation with our locticians, where they can assess your hair and decide the best technique to start your locs Do I have to pay for a consultation? No.  We offer free consultation Do I pay extra for getting my hair washed? No.  All the hair styles that we offer come with a complimentary wash and conditioner.  You only pay for hair care where wash and conditioning your hair is only what you are scheduled for I am a new client; how do I go about hair care? At Kinks Couture, our priority is the health of your hair.  On that basis, all our new clients are given a free hair-health assessment. In this session we diagnose any unhealthy issues and prescribe a treatment plan or process for your hair and scalp How do I prepare for my hair service appointment? Prepping yourself for your hair service helps in many ways to make the process faster and easier for both you and the stylist.   Here are some ways that you can prep yourself for your hair service: Ensure that all braids and twists are taken out and your hair detangled before your service. Be on time for your hair service.   If you are running behind, please give us a courtesy call so we can possibly make adjustments for the next client in line. Be sure to wear a top that can be taken off with ease, without messing up your fresh hair-do, especially if you have an event to attend after getting your hair done. If you can, be prepared budget-wise, just in case your stylist advise you of any necessary additional service you may need.   For example, you may need hydration for dry hair, or scalp boost for excessively dry and flaky scalp. Can I loc my hair if most of it is permed? Locs are best formed with naturally kinky hair due to the cylinder shape formation that occurs.  However, there are options: you can either wait for your hair to grow out a few inches where you can start your locks, or add loc extensions (see loc extension). Can I get Two Strand Twist with my perm hair? Yes you can. But it won’t stay and the formation will be flat and stringy because of the lack of elasticity in the texture. One can achieve a fuller look and longer lasting if extensions are added. For example, Kinky Twists. If I just recently permed my hair can I get braids? Chemicals break down the bonds of your hair. A freshly permed hair is in a fragile state and breakage can occur if braided. It is therefore best to wait at least three weeks before you add extensions to your freshly permed hair How do I transition into natural hair without doing The Big Chop? (Cutting off my hair all at once.) It can be difficult and frustrating when one decides to grow out their natural hair and have to deal with two textures; yet in spite of that, they keep the length for fear of not liking a shorter look, for the option of going back to a perm should they change their mind, or for the flexibility in styling with a longer length.  Holding on to your perm texture while growing out your hair is doable if you get protective styles that do not require daily grooming. This can be achieved by getting braids with your own hair or with extensions. If you want a more open style where you will be able to wear your own hair loose, you can get a textured twist-out or rod set, where both your hair textures are manipulated to create one textured look. These styles also do not require daily combing, brushing or blow drying. Most transitional styles with extensions last between two and three months. During this time you may gain a couple of inches of new growth. In between these transitional styles, your hair can be cut a few inches until your natural tresses get to a desired length where you are comfortable to do the BIG CHOP. How long does it take to grow out my perm and what products should I use while I’m growing out the perm? Each person’s hair grows at a different rate.  It may take 8 months to a year for one person to have 4-6 inches of new growth while for another it may only take 6-8 months. As your new growth sets in, it’s best to keep your hair in protective hair styles, as it makes it less likely to get damage. Use a petroleum free scalp grease on your scalp two to three times per week. Shea-butter is a great moisture agent that you can use pre-blow-drying as it serves as a heat protectant. Moisturizing leave-in conditioners are good agents for the hair. Split ends can stunt your growth, get rid of them. Why do I have split ends and how can I get rid of it? The protective layer of your hair (the cuticle) can be damaged from different causes, like over-processing hair with chemicals, excess direct heat application (Like blow dryers and curling irons.), harshly brushing hair, or ripping your hair while taking braids or twists apart, just to name a few.  Although some products can temporarily seal split ends, it is best to cut it off.  Split ends can get worse if ignored, and will gradually split up to the shaft, and sometimes all the way to the root until it completely breaks off.  Hair that lacks moisture is also susceptible to getting split ends.  Another preventative measure is to be careful when combing hair.  Comb hair gently from tip to root with wide teeth comb or fingers and deep condition hair as often as needed. What are the best Transitional Styles for my hair? The best transitional style for anyone is the style that suits them and their lifestyle.  There is a variety of styles to choose from. It is best to have a consultation with an expert hair specialist who can listen to, understand, and recommend, a style that will be healthy for your hair. A style that will best suit the shape of your face and your day-to-day life. Transitional styles Transitional Styles are hairstyles that help you during the process of growing out your natural hair. They are low maintenance and on-the-go styles that can be styled for formal occasions, corporate settings or an after-work-jam on the beach, and your hair does not have to be 100% natural in order to get one of them. Transitional Styles are also best for intervals of perms and relaxers, for long or short periods. Consult with one of our Natural Hair Specialists at Kinks Couture, who will help you to decide on the best Transitional Style that will suit your shape face, lifestyle and budget. Boost your scalp. Boost your scalp with Scalp Boosting Treatment and experience faster hair growth and healthier scalp. Scalp Boosting Treatment is for those with dry flaky scalp and clogged up pores.  These scalp conditions reflect poor scalp health, and can be caused by various conditions.  For example, Psoriasis, eczema, poor nutrition, dehydration and over-shampooing your hair, dumping.  By getting our special scalp boosting treatment, your scalp can quickly transition from parched and irritated too soft and smooth.  Remember, healthy scalp produces healthy hair. Go to Shop Book Now SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE Hair Restoration Treatments Given 8 0 8 0 ,000 + 5 Star Google Reviews 8 0 8 0 8 0 + Natural Hair Specialists 8 0 8 0 + South Florida’s #1 South Florida’s #1 Natural Hair Care Destination Kinks Couture is More Than a Salon — It’s a sanctuary where natural beauty meets holistic haircare, creating an experience that empowers, uplifts, and transforms. At Kinks Couture, we believe hair is more than an accessory—it’s a reflection of your journey, personality, and story. That’s why we don’t just style hair; we restore, regrow, and repair it. Our mission is to celebrate the unique beauty of natural hair while providing the care and nurturing it truly deserves. Serving the communities of Pembroke Pines and Miami, Kinks Couture is here to elevate your natural haircare journey. About Us – Kinks Couture Skip to content Skip to footer Home Services About Us Locations AquaFro Growth Organics Shop Home Services About Us Locations AquaFro Growth Organics Shop About Us Close Home Services About Us Locations AquaFro Growth Organics Shop Have a Project? info@website.com Want to Enroll Now? Find Courses Want to Buy Supplies? Go to Shop About Kinks Couture Kinks Couture is More Than a Salon — it’s a sanctuary where natural beauty and holistic haircare converge to create an empowering and uplifting experience. We are not just about styling hair; we are about restoring its health, celebrating its unique beauty, and building a community where everyone feels seen, valued, and inspired. Our Story Kinks Couture was founded by Annmarie Clinton, a master hair specialist and entrepreneur with over 24 years of experience in natural haircare. Annmarie’s journey began at just seven years old, braiding her doll’s hair, and evolved into a lifelong passion for restoring and celebrating natural hair. Today, her vision has made Kinks Couture a trusted name in South Florida’s natural hair community. With two locations in Pembroke Pines and Cutler Bay, Kinks Couture is more than a salon—it’s a haven for individuals seeking not only stunning hairstyles but also a transformative journey toward healthier hair and scalp. Our holistic approach combines innovative techniques, custom organic treatments, and therapeutic services designed to nourish, regrow, and repair natural hair. What Makes Us Different? At Kinks Couture, we go beyond the surface. Our priority is the health of your hair and scalp because we believe that vibrant, healthy hair creates the best styles. Every service we offer is infused with care, integrity, and innovation. Our exclusive Growth Organics product line, made from natural ingredients like fruits, herbs, and ocean elements, is just one example of how we set the standard for holistic haircare. We’ve also earned the trust of our community, receiving accolades such as six consecutive “Best of Pembroke Pines Awards” and being inducted into the Pembroke Pines Business Hall of Fame. Kinks Couture has also been featured in Essence magazine as South Florida’s hotspot for natural hairstyles. Our Mission Kinks Couture is here to do more than style hair—we’re here to restore confidence, celebrate natural beauty, and empower you to embrace your unique texture. Whether you’re looking for expert care for locs, protective styles, or scalp and hair restoration, our team of highly skilled specialists brings 5 to over 30 years of experience to every appointment. The Future of Kinks Couture Our commitment to innovation continues with the upcoming launch of AquaFro, a pioneering haircare line tailored for Black swimmers. Set to debut in Spring 2025, AquaFro reflects our dedication to creating solutions for overlooked needs in the natural hair community. This structure delivers an inspiring, clear, and compelling story while showcasing your expertise, credibility, and passion. It creates a strong emotional connection and emphasizes what makes Kinks Couture unique. Our Philosophy: Holistic Haircare at Its Best At Kinks Couture, we believe that truly beautiful hair styles begins with healthy hair and scalp. Our philosophy, rooted in Holistic Haircare, goes beyond styling—it’s about nurturing and restoring your hair from the inside out. We combine our expertise in natural hair styling with the healing properties of nature to create personalized solutions for every client. Whether you’re seeking protective styles, braids, locs, or custom treatments, we prioritize the overall health and vitality of your hair and scalp. Every service is designed to repair, regrow, and restore, ensuring your hair thrives in its natural state. Our highly skilled team is trained in advanced techniques and committed to using only the best, all-natural products. From our Growth Organics line to our signature steam therapies, we focus on providing treatments that are as effective as they are gentle. At Kinks Couture, we don’t just make you look good—we help you feel great, confident, and empowered to embrace your natural beauty. HEALTHY HAIR Meet the Visionary Behind Kinks Couture From braiding her doll’s hair as a young girl to owning and operating two thriving salons, Annmarie Clinton has always been driven by a passion for hairstyling and a purpose to empower. Her journey began with a childhood love for hair and evolved into a mission to create a space where natural hair is celebrated and cared for. Annmarie founded Kinks Couture with the vision of not just styling hair, but restoring its health and helping clients embrace the beauty of their natural textures. Her dedication to holistic haircare inspired the creation of Growth Organics, a signature product line crafted from all-natural ingredients. Designed to nurture, restore, and maintain the health of kinky, coily, and curly hair, Growth Organics embodies Annmarie’s commitment to providing effective, gentle, and nature-inspired solutions for her clients. With over 24 years of experience as an innovative product developer, master trainer and entrepreneur, Annmarie continues to set the standard for excellence in natural hair care, creating transformative experiences for every client who walks through her doors. A Message From Our General Manager, Harold Keith Working with Kinks Couture over the last few years has been an eye-opening journey. It’s a culture that has allowed me to grow creatively, make a greater impact, and embrace new adventures. I’m beyond proud to be part of such an innovative, passionate, and dedicated team who not only love what they do but are committed to making a difference in the lives of every client that we service. Call me biased, but I truly believe we have the best team and clients in all of South Florida! I’m excited to witness—and actively contribute to—our expansion and global impact. After all, we don’t just do hair, we protect it. If you haven’t checked us out yet, do so, and you’ll see why we’re the best at what we do What We Do We help you reach your goals, through Styling and some kink Solutions to help you feel better HAIR IS OUR PASSION Why Choose Kinks Couture? Expertise and Experience With over two decades of professional experience, founder Annmarie Clinton has trained and mentored our team to deliver top-tier services tailored to each client’s unique needs. Our stylists bring a wealth of knowledge, advanced techniques, and a shared passion for holistic haircare to every appointment. Custom Organic Treatments Our exclusive Growth Organics line is crafted from the finest natural ingredients, including natural oils, herbs, fruits, vegetables, and ocean elements. These custom treatments are designed to address a range of hair concerns, such as dryness, breakage, itchy scalp, and protein deficiency, offering personalized care to restore and maintain healthy, vibrant hair. Award-Winning Service Named one of South Florida’s top natural hair salons by Essence Magazine, Kinks Couture is synonymous with excellence. We’ve been honored as the “Best Hair Salon of Pembroke Pines” for six consecutive years and proudly inducted into the Pembroke Pines Business Hall of Fame. These accolades reflect our unwavering commitment to quality, innovation, and community impact. At Kinks Couture, we combine expertise, personalized care, and a deep respect for natural beauty to provide an unmatched haircare experience. Our Community and Values At Kinks Couture, community is at the heart of everything we do. Our Kid Zone is designed to teach children to embrace and care for their natural textures, helping them build a foundation of self-confidence that lasts a lifetime. We are also dedicated to supporting working mothers, single parents, and families from diverse backgrounds, including those seeking guidance on caring for African American children’s hair. Our commitment goes beyond styling—we empower families with the knowledge and tools to care for their hair independently. By fostering education, pride, and connection, we create a welcoming space where everyone feels valued and supported in their natural hair journey. Natural Hair is What We Do FAQ’s Careers Blog Privacy Policy Kinks Couture © 2025. All rights reserved. Subscribe for the updates! Subscribe I agree to the Privacy Policy .                 $ Search Log in Cart Item added to your cart View cart Check out Continue shopping About Our Founder/Creative Director Meet Kiran Patel, the creative force behind KPC. With a deep love for India's beautiful fabrics and a knack for modern design, Kiran set out to make Indian fashion shine worldwide. While having traveled back and forth to India and now living in Seattle with her family, Kiran's designs blend old traditions with new styles. She's passionate about keeping ancient techniques alive in every KPC outfit. Kiran is not just a designer; she's also a wife and a mom. She knows how to juggle it all with grace. In her rare moments of downtime, Kiran finds solace and joy in her love for sports, adding an extra layer of vitality to her already dynamic persona. As a trendsetter in Indian fashion, Kiran loves pushing boundaries and bringing out the uniqueness in everyone through her designs. Get on the list. Stay up to date on our latest arrivals, special events, exclusive sales, and more!
